subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|いや|yomi=k}}

Possibly [[onomatopoeia]] as a general expression of [[disgust]].  Compare similar terms in many different languages, such as {{noncog|en|yuck}}, {{noncog|fi|yök}}, {{noncog|ar|يَع}}, {{noncog|tr|ıyak}}, {{noncog|th|ยี้}}.

subSections.title: Adjective
Usage notes
subSections.text: {{ja-r|いや}} sounds more masculine than {{ja-r|やだ}}, which has the same meaning but is more feminine.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|嫌がる|いやがる}}: to [[dislike]] something; to be [[reluctant]] to do something
* {{ja-r|嫌がらせ|いやがらせ}}: [[harassment]], [[nuisance]]
* {{ja-r|嫌む|いやむ}}: to [[dislike]] something, to [[hate]] something
* {{ja-r|嫌み|いやみ}}: [[sarcasm]]; something [[sarcastic]] or [[snide]]; [[disagreeability]]
* {{ja-r|嫌らしい|いやらし.い}}: [[disagreeable]], [[unpleasant]], [[disgusting]] {{qualifier|less strong than plain {{m|ja|嫌|tr=iya}}}}; [[vulgar]], [[indecent]], [[lascivious]]
{{der-bottom}}
